page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Farming is an important occupation in this area, despite being so close to a major town. Farms on the whole are arable, few livestock being kept. Two of the local farms provide a dairy service, milk and cream delivered to local homes. The milk is not processed on the farms but is sent away. One of the largest farms in the area grows cereal crops and oil seed rape. The farmer supplies horse and pony food for the many local stables and horse owners. Most of the soil on the farms is grade 2 agricultural land. Horticulture and market gardening are also important in the area. Pick your own fruit and vegetables are a regular feature in summer months, especially strawberries. A large nursery/garden centre has been set up in Hawley which is expanding all the time.
